intro: Impatiens pseudolongipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of western Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in a range of colors including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly seen in its natural habitat.
